intro: Triquiliopsis palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's triquiliopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, yellowish-brown blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
